ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs
ygData.msgSnippet: Then why are they PvP?  Why give them the ability to interact this way at all?  It like taking your kid into a candy store and leaving him alone there, with no
ygData.messageBody:
Then why are they PvP? Why give them the ability to interact this way at
all? It like taking your kid into a candy store and leaving him alone
there, with no supervision and telling him not to eat any candy. It makes
no sense. I've seen guides and Gm's interacting in these ways with the
players and the world all the time. I have an older copy of the Guide regs,
it does state you are not to fight with other players but it in no way leads
you to believe that this is one of the "10 commandments".

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 3:14 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Other zoning bugs


Um. Killing a player is not considered a minor infraction to Guides.
It is one of the first things I was told by a Guide friend that they
COULD NOT do. No spells, no fighting players, no interacting with the
world in other than talking at ALL.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
>Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 2:05 PM

>Still I think the way they were treated was insulting, and losing their
>guide status for one very minor infraction was overkill.
